::: {.overlay-fragment .fragment data-fragment-index=11}

::: {.info-box-sienna}

<span class="mplsienna">Problem 3.4: MB-ML for task-oriented CSI compression</span>

$$
\mini{f_{\btheta_{\textsf{e}}}, \text{ } g_{\btheta_{\textsf{d}}}}{\espo{ \mu\left(\left(\textcolor{#4682B4}{g_{\btheta_\textsf{d}}} \circ \textcolor{#B22222}{f_{\btheta_\textsf{e}}}\right) \left(\bh\right), \bH \right) }{\bH \sim p_{\bH}}}{\left(f_{\btheta_\textsf{e}},g_{\btheta_\textsf{d}}\right) \in \mathcal{H}}
$$

where:
$$
\begin{aligned}
    \textcolor{#B22222}{f_{\btheta_\textsf{e}}} \colon  \mbbC^{D} &\longrightarrow  \mbbR^d\\
    \bh  &\longrightarrow  \bz
\end{aligned}
$$

and:

$$
\begin{aligned}
    \textcolor{#4682B4}{g_{\btheta_\textsf{d}}} \colon \mbbR^d \times \cdots \times \mbbR^d &\longrightarrow  \mbbC^{D\times K}\\
    \left\{ \bz_1, \cdots, \bz_K \right\} &\longrightarrow \bW
\end{aligned}
$$

- **Goal**: find $\textcolor{#B22222}{f_{\btheta_\textsf{e}}}$, $\textcolor{#4682B4}{g_{\btheta_\textsf{d}}}$
- **Error measure**: beamforming-based $\rightarrow \mu$


:::

:::

### ENCODING: CHANNEL CHARTING

::: {.slide-footnote .fragment data-fragment-index=1}
P. Ferrand, M. Guillaud, C. Studer and O. Tirkkonen, "*Wireless Channel Charting: Theory, Practice, and Applications*", in *IEEE Commun. Mag.*, 2023
:::

- How to encode channels?

::: {.info-box .fragment data-fragment-index=1}

**Channel charting:** dimensionality reduction method that preserves local neighborhoods

:::

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width=40%}
<div style= "margin-top: .5em"></div>

::: {.fragment}
- Channel $\bh_i \in \mbbC^D$
:::

::: {.fragment}
- Pseudo-loc. $\bz_i = \textsf{E}\left(\bh_i\right) \in \mbbR^d$
<div style= "margin-left: 2em">$\rightarrow$  <span class="alg">$d = 2\ll D = 1024$</span> </div> 

:::

::: {.fragment}
- Channel charting objective:
$$
\norm{\bx_i - \bx_j}{2} \simeq \gamma \norm{\bz_i - \bz_j}{2}
$$

:::

:::

::: {.column width=60%}

::: {.centered-svg .fragment}

<img src="images/cc/chart.svg"
      height="700"/>


:::

:::
:::

::: {.overlay-fragment .fragment}

::: {.questionbox style="--qbox-width: 80%;"}

::: {.questionbox-title}
**MB-ML paradigm application**
:::

Use the physical channel model to <span class="alg">__*structure*__</span> and <span class="alg">__*initialize*__</span> a neural encoder/decoder.

:::

:::

---

### MB-ML APPROACH

- A branch of channel charting is distance-based (ISOMAP)

<div style= "margin-top: -1em"></div>

::: {.fragment data-fragment-index=1}
- Idea: use a physical channel model <span class="alg">to design a distance adapted to channel charting</span> *[Le Magoarou]*
:::


<!-- ::: {.centered-svg}

<img src="images/cc/PI_motivations_1.svg"
      class = "fragment instant-replace"
      data-fragment-index=2
      height="700"/>

<img src="images/cc/PI_motivations_2.svg"
      class = "fragment instant-replace"
      data-fragment-index=3
      height="700"/>

:::

::: {.fragment .instant-replace data-fragment-index=4}

::: {.info-box}

Solution *[Le Magoarou]*: Phase-insensitive distance

$$
d\left(\bh_i, \bh_j\right) = \sqrt{2-2 \frac{\abs{\bh_i^\herm \bh_j}}{\norm{\bh_i}{2} \norm{\bh_j}{2}}}
$$

:::

:::

::: {.overlay-fragment .fragment .instant-replace-overlay data-fragment-index=5}

::: {.overlay-box}

How to use this distance to **structure** the encoder?

:::

::: -->

### KEY TAKEAWAYS

::: {.incremental}
- In FDD system, CSI feedback entails [significant complexity]{.alr}
- MB-ML was leveraged to <span class="alg">**structure**</span> and <span class="alg">**initialize**</span> a neural encoder and decoder
- This allowed to:
  - Perform **efficient** CSI compression
  - Obtain good beamforming performance at **high compression ratios**
  - Obtain inter-UE interference cancellation **without considering it during training**
:::


::: {.slide-footnote}
*FDD: Frequency Division Duplex*

*CSI: Channel State Information*
:::
